text: <@U13TWBRBL|jzhang> pinned a message to this channel.
<@U3AFRMY68> you have to listen to “CHAINCODE EVENTS” from grpc channel on the peer
if you want event from chaincodes
and “REJECTION” events if you want transaction with problems
these events are not javascript events …
is more messages passed through a GRPC channel
got it ?
<@U0N4D2T61> how can I access these events with the node SDK? can I listen to them like: 'tx.on('submitted', function(results) {'?
<@U3AFRMY68> I need to have a look on the nodeSDK, in go you can do it like this : <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/tree/master/examples/events/block-listener>

<@U0N4D2T61> I see, so errorhandling is not implemented yet in the node SDK. <@U0PB67X4K> you were mentioning me yesterday that I can use the hfc to listen for block events, how do I go about that to handle chaincode errors?
<@U3AFRMY68> I do not say it is not implemented, I say I do not know yet
<@U0N4D2T61> Sorry my bad, I'll get myself some coffee :slightly_smiling_face:

<@U3AFRMY68> you can hook up nodeSDK (v0.6) to chaincode events like this:

```
var regid = eh.registerChaincodeEvent(testChaincodeID, "evtsender", function(event) {
        console.log(util.format("Custom event received, payload: %j\n", event.payload.toString()));
        eh.unregisterChaincodeEvent(regid);
    });
```
where `eh` is the event hub object you can obtain from the chain object: `var eh = chain.getEventHub();`

you can see a more complete example here written by <@U13Q594J2>:
<https://github.com/ratnakar-asara/NodeSdkSample/blob/master/events/event-sample.js>

attachments.title: ratnakar-asara/NodeSdkSample
attachments.text: NodeSdkSample - A sample program to demonstrate NodeSdk apis

text: REJECTION events were not supported in v0.6 IIRC, <@U0KQ9QKH6> would know for sure
thats correct REJECTION events were not supported in the sdk in v0.6
jzhang : thank you, to what events can I listen? I replace the "evtsender" with an event I want to listen to right?
yes you replace “evtsender” with the custom event name that your chaincode uses in “stub.setEvent()” calls

or if your chaincode does not use custom events (aka “CHAINCODE” events), then use the regular `tx.on(‘complete’, …)` calls to listen to BLOCK events and you’ll be passed the committed transaction corresponding to `tx`
thanks, I could also check if the transaction id exists on the peer right? and how can I check if a transactionID exists on the peer?
such as /transactions/{tx id} on the rest API

<@U13TWBRBL> FYI, I just submitted a COP change set which affects the SDKs.   See <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3237/>
The enroll request body is changed from sending a CSR (Certificate Signing Request) to sending JSON which contains the CSR.
Specifically, it is '{"Request": "<CSR>"}'
ooppss ... make that {"request": "<CSR>"}
Once more :slightly_smiling_face:  Here is the full definition, where "certificate_request" is the name of the field containing the CSR.
